definition: to scatter like birds and beasts
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
variant of 屌[diao3]/penis
beast/animal/beastly/bestial
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
variant of 散[san4]
lit. scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/fig. to head off in various directions/to flee helter-skelter
to scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/to flee in all directions

sentences.english: The party fizzled out before midnight.
sentences.chinese: 参加聚会的人在午夜前作鸟兽散。

sentences.english: With their commander gone, the remainder of the Burning Legion's army was cast into disarray.
sentences.chinese: 指挥官阵亡，燃烧军团的余党作鸟兽散。

sentences.english: At the first sign of trouble, the supporters melted away.
sentences.chinese: 那些支持者一看要有麻烦便作鸟兽散。

sentences.english: But the indigenous peoples did not run away.
sentences.chinese: 但是，土著人并没有如鸟兽散。

sentences.english: When the People's Liberation Army crossed the Yangtse River, the U. S. colonial government at Nanking fled helter-skelter.
sentences.chinese: 人民解放军横渡长江，南京的美国殖民政府如鸟兽散。

definition: lit. scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/fig. to head off in various directions/to flee helter-skelter
to scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/to flee in all directions
to disperse in confusion (idiom)
see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]
to scatter in all directions
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
When the tree topples the monkeys scatter. (idiom); fig. an opportunist abandons an unfavorable cause/Rats leave a sinking ship.
lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom)/fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
to steal away/to beat it
to run away/to escape/to avoid
to keep quiet out of fear (idiom)
to flee/to run away
to respond instantly/to act at once on hearing the news
to scamper off/to scurry off like a frightened rat
to vanish/to be nowhere to be found/unfounded (story)
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
lit. lay down the flag and still the drums (idiom); fig. to cease/to give in
